title: Burger & Lobster keen to get its claws on new restaurants
text:
Restaurant chain Burger & Lobster is targeting at least 10 new sites despite a deterioration in profits.

Sales fell a tenth to £38m, accounts to be filed this week will reveal. Pre-tax profit slipped from £3.1m to £2.8m in 2018.

Part-owned by Qatar’s royal family, Burger & Lobster’s fortunes fell flat four years ago.

“The story was similar to the whole industry, we expanded too fast… we had to rethink the model,” said finance chief Dasha Ovchenkova.

The chain was set up by George Bukhov-Weinstein and Misha Zelman in 2011, in a bid to make lobster more affordable.
